availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Executive Journal, 1859-1862

body.p:
10
The Governor approved an account of $3102.94/100 to the Deaf & Dumb Asylum for Board &c &c of its inmates for the quarter ending 3d December 1860
Also approved a Warrant to Grant Green for $166.66/100 his months Salary ending Octo. 31 1860
He remitted to Edwd Merkley a judgment of the Jefferson Circuit Court for $800, upon a forfeited recognizance.
He respited for twelve months a judgment by a Justice of the Peace for Shelby County of $30. and fifteen days imprisonment against Joseph Roach for breach of the peace.

He issued his Warrant for the execution of Jane (a slave) sentenced by the Owen Circuit Court to be hung on the 14th day of September last for the crime of murder (the Judgment of the court below having been affirmed by the Court of Appeals) and fixed the time of her execution on the 14th day of December 1860.
